Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: Some 73% of Democratic registered voters in the Reuters/Ipsos poll said they were more excited about voting in November after Harris entered the race.
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: Respondents to the Reuters/Ipsos poll; used to gauge enthusiasm among Democratic voters

Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: And while a March Reuters/Ipsos poll found that 61% respondents who intended to vote for Biden were doing so mainly to stop Trump, 52% of Harris voters in the August poll were voting to support her as a candidate rather than primarily to oppose Trump.
Unnamed Group of People.Name of Source: Respondents to the Reuters/Ipsos poll (March and August)
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: Respondents to the Reuters/Ipsos poll; used to compare voting motivations between Biden and Harris supporters

Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: Voters picked Trump as having a better approach to managing the U.S. economy, 45% to 36%...
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: Respondents to the Reuters/Ipsos poll; used to gauge opinions on economic management

Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: Some 41% of voters in the poll - and 70% of Democrats - said they were worried the next president might sign a national ban on abortions.
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: Respondents to the Reuters/Ipsos poll; used to gauge concerns about abortion policy

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: Across four Reuters/Ipsos polls conducted in July, Harris had a 9 point lead among women and a 6 point lead among Hispanics.
Document Sources.Source Justification: Previous polls conducted by Reuters/Ipsos; used to compare current lead with past results

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: A separate Bloomberg News/Morning Consult poll published later on Thursday showed that Harris was either leading or tied with Trump in each of those states.
Document Sources.Source Justification: External poll published by Bloomberg News/Morning Consult; used to provide additional context on state-level results

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: "It's obvious that running against Harris is more challenging for Trump given the shift in these numbers, but it's certainly not insurmountable,"
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Worked on Trump's 2020 campaign; providing expert analysis on the challenges of running against Harris

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: "We see it in this poll that people are more motivated about the future than the past,"
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Representing a liberal group aiming to grow the numbers of women of color in elected office; providing interpretation of poll results

Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: Conductor of the poll; providing data on the presidential race

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: She the People, a liberal group that aims to grow the numbers of women of color in elected office.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: Context for Aimee Allison's quote; representing the organization's mission

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: Bloomberg News/Morning Consult poll published later on Thursday...
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: External source providing additional poll data; used for comparison with Reuters/Ipsos poll
